value.title: Export the Data of a Power BI table entirely in a few Clicks
value.excerpt: If you want to export the data of a Power BI table, you have options such as copy and paste, or putting it in a visual and export it. However, there is an easier way available too. You can use Power BI Helper (free tool) to export the entire data of the table. The instruction below explains how it is
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/bd_DluFQmEc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Extract Parts of a Text Value in Power BI using a Delimiter Power Query Transformation
value.excerpt: If you have a text field and you want to extract a part of that text field, there are multiple ways to do that. You can do this using the SUBSTRING function in DAX. However, These types of actions are better to be done using Power Query transformations. Fortunately, Power Query is very easy and simple
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/oiEkRkHNFCc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Find Lost Customers Using Power BI and DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, you will learn how to use Power BI and DAX to find lost customers and new customers easily. If you want to see step by step blog post details, read it here: 'http://radacad.com/lost-customers-dax-calculation-for-power-bi

value.title: Get Data from Multiple Excel Files with Different Sheet Names into Power BI
value.excerpt: The ability to use Get Data from Folder in Power BI is a very useful option. However, if your sheet names are different in the list of Excel files, then you will face a problem. In this video, Iâ€™ll explain a method you can use that works regardless of the sheet names. Download the sample files from my

There are other benefits also to import Azure Active Directory (AAD) users loaded into Power BI for

value.excerpt: There are a couple of useful actions that help a lot in cleaning data; removing digits, or keeping digits and removing everything else. In this short video, Iâ€™ll explain a simple method to do that using Power Query. Codes are in my blog article here: https://radacad.com/remove-digits-or-keep-them-in-power-bi-using-power-query

This is an article and video explaining those in detail and helping you in your journey to become a Power BI Developer. Find all the links in my blog article

value.excerpt: When applying text transformations in Power BI using Power Query; two very important transformations that can help are; Trim and Clean. These two mistakenly often considered to do one thing, but they are different. In this short article and video, Iâ€™ll explain their differences through an example. find

If you know what are things you need to have the dynamic RLS implemented, it makes the whole process simple. So this

value.title: Apply AND Logic to Multiple Selection in DAX Slicer
value.excerpt: When you apply a multiple selection to a slicer or to a filter, you obtain a logical OR condition between selected items. This video shows how to implement a logical AND condition in a measure instead of the standard OR one. Article and download: https://sql.bi/26121?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #08: Add filters using IN

value.title: Deep dive into measure filters in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, we perform a deep analysis of the DAX queries generated by Power BI when you use a measure as a filter in a Power BI visual. The DAX code generated might show a different behavior whether the measure is part of the values shown in the visual or not.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/721618?aff=yt

value.title: Using OR conditions between slicers in DAX
value.excerpt: How to implement a logical OR condition between two slicers of a Power BI report, or of a PivotTable in Excel. By default, when relying on more than one slicer they are considered in an AND condition. This video+article explains how to change this behavior using DAX.  Article and sample download: https://sql.bi/66373?aff=yt

value.title: Get started with Microsoft Viva Insights (Workplace Analytics)
value.excerpt: Collaboration is a key component of knowledge-worker success. Microsoft Viva Insights (Workplace Analytics) turns Microsoft 365 data into useful insights about how organizations get work done and empowers leaders to drive strategies for positive change. Get started with Microsoft Workplace Analytics introduces how you can use Workplace Analytics to access these insights. You will learn what Workplace Analytics is and how it works, how to onboard to Workplace Analytics from the administrator perspective, how you can evaluate and track collaboration with the Ways of working assessment, and how you can use Workplace Analytics and MyAnalytics to drive organizational change.

topItems.title: Analyze collaboration and engagement using the Workplace Analytics Ways of working assessment dashboard
topItems.excerpt: Learn to evaluate collaboration culture and employee experience with a Power BI template using Workplace Analytics data.

topItems.title: Drive organizational change with Microsoft Workplace Analytics and MyAnalytics
topItems.excerpt: After using Microsoft Workplace Analytics and Power BI to generate insights about your employeesâ€™ work behaviors, youâ€™ll learn about the Microsoft 365 features that can be tools to implement and measure the changes youâ€™ve identified. Youâ€™ll learn how to initiate common change practices and what tools and tactics are the most useful.

Get started with Microsoft Workplace Analytics introduces how you can use Workplace Analytics to access these insights. topItems.title: Drive organizational change with Microsoft Workplace Analytics and MyAnalytics

Youâ€™ll learn how to initiate common change practices and what tools and tactics are the most useful.

value.title: Manage workspaces and datasets in Power BI
value.excerpt: Once you have created your Power BI data sets and reports, itâ€™s time to deploy them so the users can take advantage of all of your hard work. In this Learning Path, you will learn how to create workspaces in the Power BI service. You will deploy your Power BI artifacts here and share them to your users. You will also learn how to connect Power BI reports to on-premise data sources. Your users will appreciate seeing the latest data in your reports, so you will configure automatic refresh for your Power BI datasets. Row-level security allows you to create one report, but have users be restricted to see only the data that applies to them. This targets data to users, without having to create multiple reports.

topItems.title: Create and manage workspaces in Power BIÂ
topItems.excerpt: This module explains how you can share reports and datasets with your users and how to create a deployment strategy that makes sense for you and your organization. Furthermore, you will learn about data lineage in Microsoft Power BI.

topItems.title: Manage datasets in Power BIÂ
topItems.excerpt: In Power BI, you can build multiple reports from a single dataset. This means that if you change the dataset, all the reports will be updated with that change. It also means that you can do the work of cleaning and prepping data a single time, instead of repeatedly for each report. Once a dataset has been deployed, you'll want to automatically refresh it, so the users see the most current data in their reports. By using the Power BI gateway, it's possible to retrieve data from on-premise data sources, for instance a SQL Server that might be in your organizationâ€™s data center.

topItems.title: Implement row-level security
topItems.excerpt: Row-level security (RLS) allows you to create a single or a set of reports that targets data for a specific user. In this module, you will learn how to implement RLS by using either a static or dynamic method and how Microsoft Power BI simplifies testing RLS in Power BI Desktop and Power BI service.

value.title: Create and manage workspaces in Power BIÂ
value.excerpt: This module explains how you can share reports and datasets with your users and how to create a deployment strategy that makes sense for you and your organization. Furthermore, you will learn about data lineage in Microsoft Power BI.

value.title: Manage datasets in Power BIÂ
value.excerpt: In Power BI, you can build multiple reports from a single dataset. This means that if you change the dataset, all the reports will be updated with that change. It also means that you can do the work of cleaning and prepping data a single time, instead of repeatedly for each report. Once a dataset has been deployed, you'll want to automatically refresh it, so the users see the most current data in their reports. By using the Power BI gateway, it's possible to retrieve data from on-premise data sources, for instance a SQL Server that might be in your organizationâ€™s data center.

value.title: Perform analytics in Power BIÂ
value.excerpt: You will learn how to use Power BI to perform data analytical functions, how to identify outliers in your data, how to group data together, and how to bin data for analysis. You will also learn how to perform time series analysis. Finally, you will work with advanced analytic features of Power BI, such as Quick Insights, AI Insights, and the Analyze feature.

value.title: Implement row-level security
value.excerpt: Row-level security (RLS) allows you to create a single or a set of reports that targets data for a specific user. In this module, you will learn how to implement RLS by using either a static or dynamic method and how Microsoft Power BI simplifies testing RLS in Power BI Desktop and Power BI service.

value.title: Drive organizational change with Microsoft Workplace Analytics and MyAnalytics
value.excerpt: After using Microsoft Workplace Analytics and Power BI to generate insights about your employeesâ€™ work behaviors, youâ€™ll learn about the Microsoft 365 features that can be tools to implement and measure the changes youâ€™ve identified. Youâ€™ll learn how to initiate common change practices and what tools and tactics are the most useful.

value.title: Price Prediction with Python and Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to create a machine learning price prediction using Python machine learning linear regression model and a dataset of 54,000 diamonds. This will be ported over to Power BI for a deeper level of interaction.  You can find the files and dataset here: https://github.com/Gaelim/Diamond-Price-Prediction

value.title: Sales Prediction Model with Python and Power BI
value.excerpt: Create a Linear Regression Model with Python and Power BI. Use What IF parameters in Power BI to give the user dynamic investment inputs.   Contact me on LinkedIn  https://www.linkedin.com/in/gaelimholland
